course.subject: EAS
course.course_title: FWS: Sustainable Earth, Energy, and Environmental Systems

notes.note: This class does not count towards the Physical and Biological Sciences (PBS) distribution requirement

The Fall 2012 offering of this course does not fulfill an ENGRD requirement for students in the College of Engineering. Students who wish to take this course to fulfill an ENGRD requirement should sign up for the Spring 2013 offering instead.
Prerequisite: EAS 1310
Enrollment limited to: Undergraduate standing in Atmospheric Science or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: EAS 2200; a calculus course (Math 1110 or 1910); one Chemistry course (high school or college).
Preequisite: Chem 2070, Math 1120, and a course in Biology and/or Geology.
Prerequisite: Two semesters of Calculus and one of Physics.
Prerequisite: 1 year Calculus, 1 semester Physics.
Prerequisite: EAS/BIOEE 1540 or EAS/BIOEE 1560 or equivalent, MATH 1120 or MATH 1920, and PHYS 2207 or PHYS 1112, or permission of instructor.
Prerequisites: MATH 1920 and PHYS 2208, PHYS 2213, or equivalent.

notes.note: Prerequisite: 1 intro course each in Statistics (e.g. AEM 2100) and Calculus.

Prerequisite: CHEM 2070 or CHEM 2090 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: EAS 3410 or thermodynamics course, and one semester of chemistry, or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: EAS 3040 or equivalent.
Prerequisite: BIOEE 1610.
